1.title: Insulation 101: One Builder's Secret Blueprint for a Net-zero Home
1.plot: Peter Amerongen of Habitat Studios shows us his secret formula for insulating the heck out of a super energy efficient net-zero home, a home that produces as much energy as it consumes.

2.title: Biogas: Brown Waste - Green Power!
2.plot: Brown gold. Prairie pies. Monkey missiles. Whatever you call them, they're all over the place in Feedlot Alley near Lethbridge, the food processing centre of Alberta.

3.title: Earthship Living in a Cold Canadian Winter
3.plot: We return to a familiar place, the Kinney Family Earthship, to see how it holds up in a Canadian prairie winter.

4.title: Carbon Neutral Laneway Home - An Innovative Use of Green Tech!
4.plot: We check out a highly innovative rental suite that will change the way we look at a back alley.

5.title: Saskatchewan Blows the Dust Off Their Dirty Electric Grid
5.plot: We visit the Morse wind farm, one of Saskatchewan's newest wind installations. The province has expressed a desire to source 50 per cent of their electric capacity from renewable energy by 2030. A big part of this will come from wind.

0.title: Pilot - Medicine Hat Smart urban green energy program
0.plot: Medicine Hat's "Hat Smart" program aims to increase the use of renewables by 25 per cent by 2020. We speak with councillor Ted Clugston of the City of Medicine Hat for his take on the future of energy in his city.

1.title: Green Energy Revolution with Chris Turner
1.plot: We speak with Chris Turner, the author of The Geography of Hope and The Leap. He has has made a career out of writing about positive solutions to the climate, energy and environmental challenges we face.

2.title: NAIT's New Alternative Energy Program
2.plot: The Northern Alberta Institute of Technology launched its alternative energy program this year and it's popular. We speak to teachers and students of this new program.

3.title: ENMAX Solar Reality
3.plot: Learn how Enmax and their Generate Choice program is making solar energy accessible to a wide swath of Albertans. They handle the permitting, the interconnection, installation and maintenance.

4.title: Net-zero homes - a mini power-plant
4.plot: Net-zero homes produce as much energy as they consume over a year. Cutting edge homebuilders have pushed the envelope and created monuments to efficiency, air-tightness and insulation.

5.title: Dan Balaban - Alberta's wind energy cowboy
5.plot: Dan Balaban is the president of Greengate Power and a wind energy entrepreneur. He has gone from no experience in renewable energy to cutting deals for the largest wind farms in Canada in five years.

6.title: Geothermal 101
6.plot: Ground source heat pumps heat over 100,000 buildings in Canada. Discover how you can heat your home with just three degrees from the ground and some electricity.

7.title: Green Lighting 101
7.plot: Learn about LEDs, CFLs, a ten million light bulb and the most energy efficient light of all time.

8.title: Awesome Dawson Creek
8.plot: Dawson Creek is in the heart of oil and gas country in the Northern Rockies. Yet, everywhere you look are signs of green energy. Learn how Dawson Creek is embracing renewable energy.

9.title: Toronto WindShare
9.plot: North America's first urban wind turbine was an important rallying point. It brought together the people and resources necessary to spawn a green energy revolution in Canada's biggest province.

10.title: Ontario's Energy Revolution
10.plot: The German style feed-in tariff that Ontario implemented in 2009 has made Ontario a North American leader in renewable energy. Learn how they did and why other provinces need to follow the lead of Ontario

11.title: Big Wind in British Columbia
11.plot: We check out two large wind projects in north-eastern BC.

12.title: Heidi Eijgel: One Farmer's Wind Story
12.plot: Heidi Eijgel is a horse farmer. She lives at the end of a gravel road surrounded by dozens of wind turbines - and that's the way she likes it. Hear her story as well as the story of her speaking tour of Ontario.

13.title: Solar Bonds: Ethical, Local Investing in Solar Energy
13.plot: SolarShare's greatest achievement? The solar bond, a $1000 bond that pays five per cent a year for five years.

14.title: The Rise of the Electric Car
14.plot: Phil Dayson has worked for and owned and sold an electric-vehicle company. He drove an electric rebuild of a Geo Metro for eight years. So when he got his hands on a brand new bright red Chevy Volt he was a happy dude.

15.title: House of the Rising Sun: Canadian Solar Is a Canada-based Solar Manufacturer
15.plot: Manufacturing solar photovoltaic modules can be a tricky game. Get a glimpse of the ups and downs of this growing industry.

16.title: Pumpjack Powerplants
16.plot: The humble pumpjack is a reciprocating pump that moves oil out of the ground. One Alberta company has figured out how to make green power from the downswing.

17.title: Light Up Alberta
17.plot: Learn about a voluntary, market-based mechanism by an innovative little electricity retailer in Alberta that's supporting solar micro-generators.

18.title: The Power of a Home Energy Audit
18.plot: This week we talk to one of the most experienced efficiency experts out there and lay out the best tips and tricks on how to save the planet, your wallet or both.

19.title: Sunny Solar Alberta
19.plot: We get the skinny on Alberta's burgeoning solar scene. We also talked to Diana McQueen, Alberta's minister for the environment and sustainable resource development.

20.title: Nova Scotia's Community Power
20.plot: Nova Scotia's community feed-in tariff is an intriguing policy and we went there to get the skinny just on how this new policy is working.

21.title: The Unlikely Walmart Sustainability Story
21.plot: It might be a surprise to see Walmart featured here at Green Energy Futures but when they apply their over-achieving corporate culture to the topic of sustainability, amazing things can happen.

22.title: The Greenest Little Campus in Canada
22.plot: The main campus of Université Sainte-Anne just might be the greenest little campus in all of Canada.

23.title: Tidal Energy 101
23.plot: Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy is home to one the strongest tides in the world. Figuring out how to take advantage of them has proven to be difficult but new in-stream technologies are currently being tested.

24.title: Our Favourite Stories of 2012
24.plot: Join us as we dive into our archives and give you our favourite clips and behind the scenes moments from 2012. From nearly falling into the Bay of Fundy to angry anti-wind protesters we go coast to coast to coast to give you best.

1.title: Waste to Willows
1.plot: Learn how willows can treat waste, increase biodiversity, ensure a healthier water supply and heat office buildings with biomass grown with waste.

2.title: Clean Energy Entrepreneurs
2.plot: Canadian clean technology companies have the potential to increase their market share from today's $9 billion to $60 billion. What can be done to ensure that Canada grows in concert with this rapidly expanding industry?

3.title: Bike City: Learning from Vancouver
3.plot: This week we learn how Vancouver became a biking mecca and what lessons they have to offer other communities interested in reducing traffic by adding cyclists.

4.title: Sewer Heat
4.plot: We head down into the sewer to explore a unique district heating scheme that heats over 2.7 million square feet in Vancouver. It's called sewage heat recovery and it's the only one of its kind in North America.

5.title: Canada's Greenest Building
5.plot: The CIRS building on the UBC building might be the greenest building in Canada.

6.title: How It Works: Run-of-river Hydroelectric Power
6.plot: Run-of-river hydro electric projects have been popping up all over British Columbia in the past five years. In fact they're up 45 projects with many more on the way. We explore the Fitzsimmons Creek run-of-river project. It's a 7.5 megawatt powerplant that puts out enough juice to meet the annual demand of the Whistler Blackcomb resort. Learn how this technology works, its advantages over traditional hydro development and its downsides this week.

7.title: Biogas: Closing the Loop on Cow-poop
7.plot: Cow poop isn't typically thought of as a valuable resource. But with a process called anaerobic digestion that cow poop can be turned into electricity, heat, a near odourless fertilizer and and animal bedding.

8.title: UBC District Heating: Low Carbon Lego
8.plot: The new hot water style district heating system at UBC burns biomass as well as natural gas.

9.title: Landfill Gas: How Old Garbage Can Generate Electricity
9.plot: Landfill gas is a way to turn old dumps into green power recovery centres. We head to Edmonton's landfill gas recovery project to learn more.

10.title: The Nest: The iPod of Programmable Thermostats
10.plot: We check out the Nest the sleekest, most popular programmable thermostat available.

11.title: Reimagine Your Office Building
11.plot: Reimagine or reskinning office buildings makes a lot of sense. You keep an existing building standing and you can save a lot of money on operating expenses.

12.title: Micro-brewed Biodiesel
12.plot: The Cowichan Bio-Diesel Cooperative is the plucky little coop that could. In 2013 they're planning to produce 150,000 to 200,000 litres with a mix of corporate and retail clients.

13.title: Landmark: How to Make More Energy Efficient Homes with Robots
13.plot: Landmark Homes in Edmonton isn't making manufactured homes, they're manufacturing homes in a state-of-the-art robot-filled factory. They build the components and then ship these energy efficient homes to the site.

14.title: T'sou-ke First Nation Goes All in on Energy Conservation and Solar
14.plot: The T'Souke First Nation on Vancouver Island slashed 75 per cent of their energy use and also installed solar photo-voltaic panels. It turns out it's a lot easier to go net-zero when you drastically cut your energy use.

15.title: Nanaimo: Turning Waste Into Compost, Carbon Credits and Electricity
15.plot: Even mid-size cities like Nanaimo now feature thriving businesses, partnerships and projects that are turning various streams of waste into compost, electricity and carbon credits.

16.title: The Grass Really Is Greener at Lawrence Grassi Middle School
16.plot: We head to Camrose, Albert to Lawrence Grassi middle school, there they built a school which is 70 per cent efficient than a comparable building and was built exactly on budget.

17.title: Net-Zero Evolution: From the Star Trek Enterprise to Utter Simplicity
17.plot: We explore the evolution from 45-person team, multi-million projects to cheaper and simpler net-zero homes. We talk to two net-zero pioneers to learn these amazing homes have improved over the years.

18.title: Car2Go: Carsharing in Calgary
18.plot: Car2Go is car-sharing service in several Canadian cities that makes it easy to get around. With services like these you might only need one car or maybe none at all.

19.title: Future of Transportation Part One
19.plot: We check out the latest EVs, hybrids and even some super efficient gas vehicles. We talk to auto industry execs and check out their lineups and find out where they're headed.

20.title: Future of Transportation Part Two
20.plot: With the Edmonton Auto Show under our belt we went to check out the Future of Transpotation Symposium There we met the people who are driving and using the next generation of vehicles today.

21.title: Big Idea: Distributed Generation
21.plot: Ever looked at the breakdown of your electricity bill with all of its transmission and distribution charges and wondered if there was a better way? There is and it's called distributed generation.

22.title: Biomass District Heating in Sherwood Park
22.plot: In Sherwood Park, Alberta just minutes from refinery row city hall, the famous Festival Place Theatre, condos, a high school and more buildings are all heated by biomass, wood to be exact.

23.title: Rocket Mass Heaters (Aka Rocket Stoves)
23.plot: The rocket stove takes our fascination with fire and bends it 90 degrees. It's a hyper efficient wood stove that uses far less wood to get a far more effective result.

24.title: Bullfrog Power
24.plot: We get behind the cute logo and figure out if Bullfrog Power is for real.

25.title: Energy Storage: The Holy Grail of Renewable Energy
25.plot: We talk to two Canadian startups working in the energy storage space, Temporal Power, a a company making flywheels and eCAMION doing community battery storage.

26.title: Morgan Solar
26.plot: We profile Morgan Solar, a Canadian startup that aims to develop a cheaper to produce and more efficient solar module.

27.title: Tom Rand and the MaRS Cleantech Fund
27.plot: Tom Rand is one of the managing partners of the MaRS Cleantech Fund. It's $30 million dollars of private money that's being invested in early stage Canadian cleantech startups. MaRS, which is based in Toronto.

28.title: Sun Country Highway
28.plot: We profile Kent Rathwell, the co-founder of Sun Country Highway a company installs electric charging stations and then drove a Tesla Roadster across Canada in the dead of winter just to prove it could be done.

29.title: The Cheap Solar Revolution
29.plot: The price of solar has dropped one hundred times in the past 35 years and the more solar panels we make the cheaper they get. Learn how we got here and where that solar market is headed.

30.title: The Amazing Earthtube
30.plot: Earth tubes are a simple, passive geothermal system. By drawing fresh air through an earth tube you pre-heat or pre-cool your air depending on your needs.

31.title: Holiday Gift Guide
31.plot: Get the green energy geek in your life the perfect gift this holiday season with our Green Energy Futures gift guide. From the best LED bulbs to super-fun electric bikes we've got five green gift ideas that really rock.

1.title: Energy Storage: Power-to-gas and Better Batteries
1.plot: We check out the latest and greatest energy storage technologies.

2.title: The Time Has Come for the Electric Bike
2.plot: The electric bike might be the single best urban transportation option out there. It's super green, gets you outside, has really low emissions and can get you up that big hill without breaking a sweat.

3.title: Alberta's CCEMC
3.plot: Five years ago Alberta introduced a small carbon levy on large carbon emitters. That idea has raised $380 million dollars so far, learn how it works and the GHG reducing projects they're investing in this week at Green Energy Futures.

4.title: Passive Solar Design
4.plot: Whether you're buying a house or designing your own we've some simple rules of thumb when it comes to orientation, windows and building materials that will make your home a more comfortable, energy efficient place to live.

5.title: Community Solar
5.plot: We head to small town Alberta to learn how the town of Black Diamond and Starland County are leading the way when it comes to community solar projects.

6.title: Harvest Power: Energy and Compost from Rotten Food
6.plot: Learn how Harvest Power turns your rotten banana peels and other gross assorted food waste into energy and compost at their site in Richmond, BC.

7.title: Vancouver's Laneway Homes
7.plot: Come take a tour of a super energy efficient laneway home in Vancouver and talk to a builder of these tiny, fun homes.

8.title: Industrial Symbiosis: Growing Tomatoes with an Ethanol Plants Waste
8.plot: We head to Chatham, Ontario to explore a unique partnership between an ethanol plant and a greenhouse.

9.title: Passive Solar Greenhouses
9.plot: A passive solar greenhouse in Invermere B.C. is making people across the continent sit up and takes notice. It may sound ironic, but most greenhouses are not designed to harvest and retain the sun's energy.

10.title: Pond Biofuels
10.plot: Pond Biofuels is an early stage Canadian company trying to turn raw smokestack gas from a cement plant into a potentially useful product - algae.

11.title: Classroom Energy Challenge
11.plot: This week we follow students at Prairie Waters school in Chestermere, Alberta to seek out and destroy energy vampires, increase energy literacy and save energy in the Classroom Energy Diet Challenge.

12.title: Chasing Net-Zero: Net-zero 101
12.plot: The first episode of our four-part series Chasing Net-Zero. We dive into the history of net-zero homes and figure out you can build one of these comfortable, beautiful homes that also doubles as a mini-powerplant.

13.title: Chasing Net-Zero: Net-zero Beautiful
13.plot: We look at making energy efficient, infill homes that are beautiful and also at how the location of your home can have a dramatic effect on your energy footprint.

14.title: Chasing Net-Zero: Net-zero Evolution
14.plot: The secret to building an affordable, net-zero home that produces as much energy as it consumes is harvesting passive solar energy. Take a tour of Architect, Shafraz Kaba's net-zero home and learn how easy it can be.

15.title: Chasing Net-Zero: Go Big or Go Home
15.plot: Landmark Homes is planning to have all of their homes be net-zero by 2015. Learn how net-zero is transitioning from small custom home builders to large scale companies.

16.title: Earthship on the Prairie
16.plot: The family of the editor and production manager of Green Energy Futures, Duncan Kinney, built an Earthship. We show how these radically sustainable homes are built and how they work.

17.title: Integrated Bio-Refinery
17.plot: On their own a feedlot, an anaerobic digester and an ethanol plant might not make sense but combine them and you've got an integrated bio-refinery where each business feeds the other in a virtuous cycle.

18.title: Echohaven: An Environmentally Friendly, Energy Efficient Suburb
18.plot: This week we head to northwest Calgary to explore Echohaven. A neighborhood that does greenfield or suburban development a whole lot differently.

19.title: Canada's First Concentrated Solar Thermal Plant
19.plot: Welcome to Canada's first concentrated solar thermal energy plant in sunny Medicine Hat, Alberta. Discover how "The Gas City" is adding solar and wind to diversify it's electricity supply in a city endowed with rich fossil fuel resources.

20.title: Solar Air Heating
20.plot: We spend a lot of money and burn a lot of carbon keeping our homes and buildings warm. Solar air heating is a simple, effective and accessible technology that could help Canada reduce its heating bills.

21.title: Green Gift Guide 2014
21.plot: We've got five great gift ideas for for the green energy or energy efficiency nerd in your life.

1.title: Big Biomass 101
1.plot: We head to one of the largest pulp mills in North America to check out how big biomass works up close.

2.title: Cowessess First Nation Has the Biggest Battery in Saskatchewan
2.plot: Energy storage is getting ready to expand across the world. We head to Cowessess First Nation in Saskatchewan to see a finished project and understand more about this important next wave of energy technology.

3.title: Winter Cycling 101
3.plot: A non-winter cyclist learns what it takes to get around on a bike in Canada's most northerly city - Edmonton. Turns out it's pretty easy, especially if you have studded tires.

4.title: Ban the Beehive: Why Wood Waste to Energy Is a No-brainer
4.plot: Whitecourt, Alberta has a pulp mill and a saw mill. With all that wood comes wood waste. We look at how one company is turning this wood waste into something useful - green electricity.

5.title: Craik, Saskatchewan: The Little Eco-village That Could
5.plot: What happens when you sell unserviced lots for a dollar and get people to build green homes on the edge of a small Saskatchewan town? We find out.

6.title: Biochar 101
6.plot: Titan Clean Energy Projects is a Saskatchewan-based company making a very interesting product: biochar. We visit their plant and learn more about this amazing product.

7.title: Mosaic Centre: Canada's Biggest Net-zero Building
7.plot: Net-zero houses are almost old news here at Green Energy Futures. But a net-zero commercial building? Now that got our attention.

8.title: Judith Sayers: First Nations Run-of-river Hydro Trailblazer
8.plot: Meet Judith Sayers, an incredible leader who got one of the first run-of-river hydro projects off the ground in B.C. that was majority owned by a First Nation.

9.title: Geothermal 201: Hitting the Geoexchange Heating and Cooling Sweet Spot
9.plot: More than 100 hundred episodes after our first episode on geothermal we circle back for a follow up.

10.title: Cradle to Cradle: Recycling's Cooler Younger Brother
10.plot: Cradle to Cradle is recycling's cooler younger brother. Learn how continuous, closed loop upcycling of the materials around us could be a huge environmental and energy win.

11.title: The Octopod: A Unique Off-grid Solar Powered Cottage
11.plot: Shipping container architecture has become more and more popular over the years. We check out an off-grid solar powered sea container cabin called the Octopod, located near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.

12.title: Net-Zero Goes Viral
12.plot: Canada's latest batch of net-zero homes is being built in Guelph, Ontario. We head to the build site to check them out up close.

13.title: How Siemens turned Tillonsburg into a clean energy town
13.plot: In a repurposed auto parts factory on the edge of Tillsonburg, Ontario the transformation of the economy of Canada's most populous province is underway.

14.title: Cochrane Sustainability High
14.plot: You could call it Sustainability High - since 2002 students in the Sustainable Development Committee at Cochrane High School in Alberta have raised almost $150,000 and build more than half a dozen green projects around their school.

15.title: Students Capture the Wind with TREC Education
15.plot: TREC Education is the largest renewable energy education program in Canada. We head to school with Grade 5s at George Webster School in Toronto, Ontario to see the light bulbs turn on with the clean energy leaders of tomorrow!

16.title: SunMine: How Solar Is Transforming an Old Mining Town
16.plot: Kimberley B.C. installed the largest solar tracking solar PV system in western Canada and it's all part of the reinvention of a mining town as tourism City and developer of clean renewable energy.

17.title: Green Acres, the Largest Solar Farm in Western Canada
17.plot: This week we visit the largest solar farm in Western Canada on the Green Acres Hutterite colony.

18.title: Solar: A Community Investment
18.plot: Evansdale Community League is now solar powered! The league has a hockey rink, community hall, basketball and ball hockey courts - now they have a 13.6 kilowatt solar system to power the community operations.

19.title: Vitoria-Gasteiz: Spain's Green Capital Is Made for Walking
19.plot: The European green capital for 2012, Vitoria-Gasteiz is small in size but big in ambition.

imdb.plot outline: Green Energy Futures is a project and a journey that seeks to share the stories of green energy pioneers who are doing incredible things just below the radar of the conventional media. Individually these people are doing interesting projects, together they are leading us all to a more sustainable energy future. Each week, our producer and host David Dodge travels to a new place across Canada and showcases an individual, town, or company that is working towards a more aspect of a sustainable life. Viewers can follow along and learn about new ways to implement these solutions into their own lives.
imdb.title: Green Energy Futures
plot: _Green Energy Futures_ (qv) is a project and a journey that seeks to share the stories of green energy pioneers who are doing incredible things just below the radar of the conventional media. Individually these people are doing interesting projects, together they are leading us all to a more sustainable energy future. Each week, our producer and host David Dodge travels to a new place across Canada and showcases an individual, town, or company that is working towards a more aspect of a sustainable life. Viewers can follow along and learn about new ways to implement these solutions into their own lives.::Anonymous
